frontmatter.title: OpenShift Commons Gathering at Kubecon North America 2021
frontmatter.venue: For in-erson attendance, register viaCNCF Kubecon Registration Portal
frontmatter.lead_text: This OpenShift Commons Gathering focused on End Users will be held on October 12th in Pacific Standard Time (PST)!
frontmatter.info_text: This OpenShift Commons Gathering will be held live in Los Angeles and broadcast live to regional watch parties around the globe. As always, our focus is on creating a space for peer-to-peer interactions and we'll be going hybrid, so if you are unable to attend in person, join us online. This Gathering will focus on talks from and by End Users with production deployments of OpenShift sharing their use cases, insights into their workloads and  lessons learned along the way. Topics covered during this Gathering include hybrid cloud infrastructure, cloud-native development, and new technology initiatives on the Edge and in Data Science . We'll have a keynote and update from Red Hat's Clayton Colemen on all things Hybrid Cloud and Kubernetes Control Plane along with an Update/Road Map on the latest release of OpenShift with deep dive live demos and Q/A with Red Hat engineers & upstream leads. Red Hat's DevOps Black Belt Sasha Rosenbaum on SRE+Managed Services, and an update on latest Red Hat OpenShift Data Science initiatives from Red Hat's Data Scientist Audrey Reznik . The event is free and registration for the virtual event is open to all. In person event is limited to the first 300 registrants, register today if you are coming to Los Angeles!
frontmatter.event_footer_text: All times local. Please note: all in-person attendees must also be registered for Kubecon/NA, all COVID protocals required by CNCF must be followed for this co-located event.

schedule.session_name: Welcome to the Commons: Unlock the Potential of Collaboration
OpenShift Release Update and Road Map
Upstream Keynote: Kubernetes as the Control Plane for the Hybrid Cloud
Coffee Break - live from Paris - OpenShift Meetup Shouts
Site Reliability Engineering, Managed Services, and the path to the future
Data Science as a Managed Service on OpenShift
Lunch Break
Broadcom Case Study: GitOps in Action
TIAA Case Study: Why Policy Management? - Cloud Security and Governance
Deploying Microservices with OKD at MarketAmerica|SHOP.COM
Electrical Training Alliance Case Study
AMA Session: Live Q/A with Guest Speakers & Red Hat Engineers, Data Scientists and Product Managers
Kubernetes 101 Boot Camp (virtual only) pre-registration required (space limited to 100)
Boot Camp Wrap Up and Additional Resources
OpenShift Commons Reception & Partner Lightning Talks - Introductions
Joget & Alliance Bank: Accelerate Digitization with Low Code Platforms
Dynatrace: Porsche Informatik accelerates innovation
Thales: Fast, Trusted Development with Thales HSMs
Cockroach Labs: CockroachDB, built from the ground up for K8s
Jetstack: Deploy a service mesh, run mTLS everywhere
Citrix: Delivers a resilient and secure app
Datadog: Observability service for cloud-scale applications
Nutanix: Fast-track the cloud native journey
Yugabyte: Cloud native Postgress of your dreams
Sysdig: Modernize, real world, secure DevOps practices
